instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan on high.
threads.message:
I ran ASD OS and got;

Check that the CPU heatsink is properly attached, using product spec theta dh + 75 percent guardband.
Error -- 255 [Unknown result code 0xff] 

I have removed, cleaned and reseated the heat sink with some nice fresh thermal paste.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan on high.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan on high.
threads.message:
ASD EFI passes no worries.
Run it three times now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan on high.
threads.message: Check all temp sensor readings in ASD hardware profile. No fan error in ASD either?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan on high.
threads.message:
Only error in ASD is the CPU Heatsink one.

Will check the readings now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan on high.
threads.message:
I don't notice anything odd in Hardware Profile.

All 'reading' are at a reasonable value between high and low for everything.
The fan says Low: 2000, High: 6200, Set: 6200, so technically it is correct too.


Edit:
Except AXG VCore Voltage is 0v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan on high.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan on high.
threads.message: Any history on this machine? BIOS chip messed with?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan on high.
threads.message:
Not sure on history, came from another shop.

Board looks really clean and tidy. Doesn't appear to have had anyone mess with it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan on high.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan on high.
threads.message: Yes, it has been bench tested with known-good everything I could think of.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan on high.
threads.message: I really don't know. Make a few pics of all sensor readings in EFI ASD, maybe I can spot something.
